intro: Bondtia mackinlayi, commonly known as the Mackinlay's bondtia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green, often with a waxy coating. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
